title: torch.utils.model_zoo — PyTorch 2.9 documentation
text:
## torch.utils.model_zoo#

Created On: Jan 09, 2017 | Last Updated On: Jun 11, 2025
Moved totorch.hub.
torch.hub
Loads the Torch serialized object at the given URL.
If downloaded file is a zip file, it will be automatically
decompressed.
If the object is already present inmodel_dir, it’s deserialized and
returned.
The default value ofmodel_diris<hub_dir>/checkpointswherehub_diris the directory returned byget_dir().
model_dir
<hub_dir>/checkpoints
hub_dir
get_dir()
url(str) – URL of the object to download
model_dir(str,optional) – directory in which to save the object
map_location(optional) – a function or a dict specifying how to remap storage locations (see torch.load)
progress(bool,optional) – whether or not to display a progress bar to stderr.
Default: True
check_hash(bool,optional) – If True, the filename part of the URL should follow the naming conventionfilename-<sha256>.extwhere<sha256>is the first eight or more
digits of the SHA256 hash of the contents of the file. The hash is used to
ensure unique names and to verify the contents of the file.
Default: False
filename-<sha256>.ext
<sha256>
file_name(str,optional) – name for the downloaded file. Filename fromurlwill be used if not set.
url
weights_only(bool,optional) – If True, only weights will be loaded and no complex pickled objects.
Recommended for untrusted sources. Seeload()for more details.
load()
dict[str,Any]
Example

```python
>>> state_dict = torch.hub.load_state_dict_from_url(
...     "https://s3.amazonaws.com/pytorch/models/resnet18-5c106cde.pth"
... )

```
